### Inspections, Testing and Maintenance of Fire Protection Systems

**Solicitation Reference Number:** 5P300-23-0332/A

**Closing Date:** June 13, 2024, at 14:00:00

**Description:**

Parks Canada invites bids for the Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance of Fire Protection Systems for the Quebec Management Unit. The scope of the contract includes the inspection, testing, and maintenance of the fire alarm, fire suppression, and sprinkler systems at various Parks Canada sites within the Quebec Management Unit.

**Contract Period:**

The contract will commence on the contract award date and terminate on March 31, 2027. The contractor will have the option to extend the contract by up to two (2) additional one-year periods.

**Security Requirement:**

The selected contractor will be required to undergo a reliability status security screening.

**Bid Submission:**

Bidders should submit their bids by email to [soumissionsest-bidseast@pc.gc.ca](mailto:soumissionsest-bidseast@pc.gc.ca). The maximum email file size that Parks Canada can receive is 15 megabytes. Bidders are responsible for any failure attributable to the transmission or receipt of the emailed bid due to file size.

**Bid Documents:**

Bid documents, including the solicitation and appendices, are available on the Government Electronic Tendering Service at [http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities](http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities).

**Security Notice:**

The Government of Canada will not accept any submissions containing links to bid documents. Bid documents must be sent as email attachments.

**Additional Information:**

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. The bid submission deadline is firm, and late submissions will not be considered.

**Quoting Instructions:**

Bidders should quote Unit Price and Extended Price in Canadian dollars. Taxes, if applicable, should be included in the submission.

**Trade Agreements:**

This solicitation is open to businesses entering into contracts in Canada under the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and other trade agreements.

**Languages:**

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Parks Canada is committed to providing equal opportunities to both English and French.

**Notes:**

Please note that Parks Canada is not currently accepting bids via SAP Ariba. Bidders are required to submit their bids by email or facsim
